Author: ÂçÅÂÖ≠Â§ú[Ëã∫]
Review:
(18/10/10)
"Kokuzoson"
Kyoto 13 Buddhist Sacred Sites 13th Fudasho "Kokuzoson"
I received two types of goshuin.

A temple belonging to the Five Wisdoms of the Shingon sect (Kogi Shingon sect).
Principal image: Kokuzo Bodhisattva
Commonly known as: Kokuzo Horinji Temple, Saga Kokuzo, Saga no Kokuzo-san
One of Japan's three major Kokuzo (Enzoji Temple in Yanaizu, Aizu, Oshu, and Kongoshoji Temple in Mt. Asama, Ise)
It is also famous as a temple for 13 visits, a needle memorial service, and a lacquer ancestral deity.
The view is also good.

Hankyu Arashiyama Line: 500m from Arashiyama Station.
Keifuku Electric Railway Arashiyama Main Line: 850m from Arashiyama Station.
Kyoto Bus (From Randen Arashiyama Station): 450m from Arashiyama Park bus stop.

It is said that wisdom can be given at the 13th temple, but it is said that if you change it at Togetsukyo on the way back, you will leave it behind. I can't help but look back at the beautiful flow of the Katsura River at Togetsukyo Bridge.

Author: Camry 2104
Review:
In Kyoto, it is famous for Jusan Mairi, and I think it would be better to call it "Kokuzo-san" rather than Horinji Temple. I visited the shrine for the first time in 18 years since my younger child's 13th visit.
The back gate is close to the south end of Togetsukyo, but if possible, it is more elegant to walk a little and climb the stone steps in front. There is a main hall when you climb up, and there is also a place like a stage overlooking Togetsukyo Bridge, which is quite a view.
I saw on TV that it was used as a location for a detective drama earlier. Will you not only give me wisdom, but also give me hints for solving cases?

Author: Ëê¨‰∫∫Êïµ
Review: Falun Temple is located on the mountainside on the south side of the famous Arashiyama Togetsukyo Bridge. It is an ancient temple with a long history. When going from Landian Arashiyama Station, you have to cross the Togetsukyo Bridge first and then climb a short flight of stairs. Arriving, the temple enshrines Kukongzang Bodhisattva. It is said that Bodhisattva can fulfill the wishes of believers. It is said that if you look back at Falun Temple when crossing the Togetsukyo Bridge after visiting, the wish you made with Bodhisattva will be recalled and disappeared. Quite an interesting local legend. This trip is because Falun Temple has special openings and activities at night in conjunction with the annual Arashiyama Lantern Road, so I have the opportunity to know this temple. The special event of the Lantern Road is to light up the main hall of Falun Temple, using various colors The lighting effect is like a light show, which is a very rare experience and visual enjoyment. In addition, the platform next to the temple can have a panoramic view of the entire Arashiyama area, and you can also overlook the Kyoto Tower. It is just right to enjoy it in the evening To the rare night view.

From what I could surmise from my visit and the Kanji I read, the temple  has to do with electricity. Review:
A custom unique to Kyoto?
My friends from other prefectures said that they were not very familiar with it.
The child is 13 years old, and it is a temple to visit.
My family visited us several years ago.

When it comes to the god of study, there is Kitano Tenmangu, which is familiar to Tenjin nationwide, but this is also the god of study.

alias? It is sometimes referred to as a "wisdom enlightenment."
A cow with crooked horns? There is a statue of the head of the statue, and you can touch the head and receive wisdom.
Then, write one kanji character and have them pray.
I don't know how effective it is, but the child himself seemed to be a little more relaxed by the ritual that he was prayed for.

I think that the number of non-religious people is increasing these days, but I felt that such customs should be preserved.

Horinji

thoughts:

Author: nb 246
Review:
An ancient temple in Arashiyama that is famous for the "Jusan Mairi". It is located across the Togetsukyo Bridge from the Randen Station. If you grew up in your hometown Kyoto, I think there are many people who remember it. Especially the jinx when crossing Togetsukyo Bridge after visiting a shrine? is smiling and comforting.
At the beginning of November, the stairs leading from the temple gate to the precincts were covered with autumn leaves that had begun to turn colors, creating a pleasant atmosphere.
In the precincts on a hill, there is a wide reinforced concrete observatory that overlooks Togetsukyo Bridge and Mt. Ogura. Personally, I was a little disappointed that this facility had a sudden feeling that did not match the atmosphere of the temple.

Author: Mi K
Review:
Visited in early November. If you want to go sightseeing in Arashiyama, first visit Horinji Temple where you can see Arashiyama across the Togetsukyo Bridge. In Kyoto, there is an old custom called Jusan-mairi, in which 13-year-old children visit Horinji Temple to receive adult wisdom, and there were many visitors.
On the way back from the 13th visit, it seems that you shouldn't turn around when crossing the Togetsukyo Bridge, which reminded me of the final tunnel scene in Spirited Away.
The god of electricity is enshrined in the middle of the stairs, and it is a must-visit for IT companies.
It was nice to be able to see the whole of Arashiyama from the stage at the top of the stairs. Autumn leaves üçÅ were also quaint.

Review: Within walking distance from Hankyu Arashiyama Station. It is a temple with a long history that has appeared in ancient stories such as The Pillow Book and Konjaku Monogatari. The principal image is Kokuzo Bosatsu, who is famous for bestowing vast wisdom, and this 13 Mairi is very famous in the Kansai area. Since ancient times, there is a legend that if you turn around until you cross the Togetsukyo Bridge, you will lose all the wisdom you received during the 13th visit. to go. After visiting here, I also crossed the Togetsukyo Bridge and visited Saga Shakado, but I crossed the Togetsukyo Bridge silently turning around so as not to lose the wisdom I received (laughs). In addition, there are plenty of other highlights such as the needle memorial service, the Dendendengu shrine, and the scenic view of Saga-Arashiyama. You can get a goshuin at the temple office.

Author: Elias Chelala
Review: Nice but small temple located near Arashiyama Moneky Park. I visited last March and it was one of the only Temple's that had a cherry blossom with flowers in all of Kyoto. It's free to go and if you are in the area I recommend you stop by.

Author: Cumulo nimbus
Review:

Author: ÂÆÖË¶ãËÇá
Review:
It started with the foundation of Gyoki Bosatsu at the imperial request of Emperor Genmei in the 6th year of Wado (713).

There is a traditional event called Jusan Mairi, which has been passed down in Kyoto since ancient times. For one month before and after April 13th, when children turn 13, they visit Horinji Temple in Arashiyama to receive wisdom and good fortune.

The principal object of worship is Gokukuzo Bosatsu, a Buddha known as Kokuzo who controls wisdom. For people in Kyoto, this place seems to be special. (meaning one step higher than Jusan Mairi at other temples)

Why is it this time of year? Recently, there is also the autumn 13 visit, which is also held from October to November. I was waiting for about 3 pairs with my parents today.

There are things you cannot do after visiting the main shrine. Patience until Togetsukyo Bridge, a serious face, clenched teeth and hurry home. The 13th visit to the temple will teach you that.

Another is the torii gate of Dendengu. A shrine that prays for the development of all electricity-related businesses and for no accidents. You can see the names of companies from home appliance manufacturers to construction companies and broadcasting companies.

On the other hand, tourists enter the precincts casually enjoying the beauty of autumn leaves. It's easy to draw omikuji and take a break at the observatory with a nice view. Eventually, I will know about Jusan Mairi from signs etc...

On the way back, you look back at the beautiful autumn leaves and take pictures!

Author: hiroaki tanaka

Author: Yuki
Review:
I went to my daughter's thirteenth mairi.
It seems to be a well-established event in Kansai, but it is not well known in Kanto (this is Shizuoka, but wow!).
I found a temple in neighboring Kanagawa Prefecture that also does the 13th Mairi, but I'd rather go to Horinji, which is a sacred place! ‚Ä¶I took a little trip to participate, but it was worth it! !
It's a very solemn temple, and the priest's sermon is good, and there are scenes that make me cry...(¬¥ÔºõœâÔºõÔΩÄ)
I've been grateful for the miracle of growing up to be a healthy and kind child.

Details are written on Horinji's website, but you don't have to write the dedication letter at home.
But it's better to decide what to write.
By the way, my daughter wrote "friend", but the other girls wrote "wisdom", "gaku", "love" and so on.
Also, if you go by car, the parking fee will be 1000 yen.

Review: Very close to Hankyu Arashiyama Station. Since I went by bicycle, there was no parking fee, but it seems that you need to pay for your own car. There is Denden Shrine in the temple, and I also visited here. From the terrace-like parking lot, you can see Togetsukyo in the distance.

Author: Yoshinori kageshima
Review:
A temple of the Shingon sect of Buddhism, located in the mountains of Arashiyama, Kyoto, where Kokuzo Bosatsu is enshrined as the principal image of worship.
Commonly known as "Saga no Kokuzo-sama"
According to the temple legend, it was founded in the 6th year of Wado and later changed its name to Horinji after enshrining a statue of Kokuzo Bosatsu!
The principal image Kokuzo Bosatsu is known as the guardian deity for those born in the year of the ox and the year of the tiger.
It seems that the needle memorial service and the 13th visit are famous events.
Jusan-mairi was originally held on March 13 of the lunar calendar.
It is called "Chie-mairi", and 13-year-old men and women make a pilgrimage to receive wisdom and good fortune. It seems that there is a message.
In the precincts of Horinji Temple, there is a shrine called Dendengu, which enshrines Denden Myojin, the guardian deity of electricity and radio waves.
Is it about a 5-minute walk from Hankyu Arashiyama Station or Randen Arashiyama Station?

Review: As soon as you cross the Togetsukyo Bridge in Arashiyama, there is a shortcut that goes up the mountain. It's famous for the 13th shrine, but since I work in the system field, I went to visit Dendengu Shrine in the Sessha. Away from the crowds of Arashiyama, the scenery from the stage is nice, so I think it's a good place to stop by.

Author: ÁßÄ
Review: It is famous for 13 visits. The view from the observatory is nice. However, the stairs are made of stones, so be careful when it rains or snows.

Author: Jun Mizuno
Review: Small shrine on a hill near Hankyu Arashiyama station, easily accessible by foot. Shrine offers great views of the Arashiyama area but unfortunately the viewing area is out of bounds before opening hours, since I visited around 8am.

Author: jyuripom
Review:
This temple is famous for Jusan Mairi.
I went too.
When I crossed the Togetsukyo Bridge on my way home, I remember my mother saying to me, "Don't look back."
When I visited again today, I thought that I had climbed the stone steps wearing a kimono to a temple on such a high mountain.
In the precincts, there is "Dendengu" where the god of electric waves is enshrined.
In addition, if you go through the gate on the right side of the main hall, there is a stage with a good view of Kyoto. There is also a bench, perfect for a short break.

Author: Kt Un

It's just a bonus, and I'm going to give you a microSD amulet.

While thinking that my faith will be tested, I peeled it off carefully and used it while muttering "thank you, thank you..." in my heart.

Author: Âº•Áîü
Review: It has a nice view and a comfortable precinct. I prayed for my daughter's healthy growth at the 13th visit.

Author: Y. S.
Review: I've been visiting the thirteen mairi with my parent and child for three generations. It is a historical and traditional temple. Thank you for your polite prayers, and I received blessings and wisdom.

Author: JW Leong
Review: A quiet hidden gem, the only obstacle is many steps! You get a wonderful view of arashiyama from up here! I also got myself a goshuin on my goshuincho for 300 yen! They close at 4.30pm so note that!

Author: 1204„Åº„Çì„Å°„ÅÉ
Review:
I used it for the 13th visit. There are only a few places nationwide where you can perform Jusanmairi, but in Kyoto, it is often done here.

In the spring season, the scenery overlooking the city of Kyoto surrounded by cherry blossoms is spectacular. I think that it is good to visit for the purpose of taking a walk.

There is Arashiyama Togetsukyo Bridge in the immediate vicinity, so you can do sightseeing in this area alone for a day.

Author: koichi
Review:
Visited with my daughter's 13th visit! It was quite a view.
It's just too crowded at this time of year. Where was the parking lot full?

Author: aiwu liu
Review: Good place

Author: Roko Kokeza
Review: Nice place to relax

Review: I visited for my grandson's 13th visit. The weather was so good that it was hot, but there were a lot of people eating and walking around Togetsukyo Bridge, but I had a great time with my grandchildren üéµ

Author: Athleticgirl 86
Review: Beautiful temple complex. Interesting buildings and architecture. Very interesting religion with the most diverse deities. Again and again you discover new and special things in the temples.

Author: Ëàû„ÅÆÂÆÆ
Review:
‚óèThe place where I made my 13th visit. This year, my child also visited 13 visits here.
‚óèAs for his age, he is 13 years old. A child who graduates from elementary school and advances to junior high school is preferable. However, now, regardless of age, if you are born prematurely between the ages of 11 and 13, there is no problem.
‚óèI think that many people from Kyoto visit this temple.
‚óèThe price varies depending on how many days you wish to pray, but as a guideline, it starts from 5,000 yen per week.
‚óèThe person receiving the prayer should come up with a favorite kanji character.
‚óèClothing seems to be various. Some people dress up, but the suit and dress used at the graduation ceremony, the junior high school uniform, and the clothes for going out. It's good if you have a feeling! ! !
‚óèBecause my legs get numb when sitting in the seiza position, is it a folk remedy to relieve the numbness in my legs when I sit with my big toes on top of each other? For reference...
‚óèAs an aside, there is a legend that children who come to visit the 13th shrine should not look back until they have crossed the Togetsukyo Bridge. Please try it on your way home.

Author: „Åæ
Review:
I visited on the 13th mairi.
Thank you very much for giving my son wisdom.

Both brothers and sisters visited each other with Jusanmairi.
After the memorial service, I feel that my face has tightened and changed.

I am grateful that I was able to visit the temple safely with my child, just like my parents took me, while feeling awe for the customs of the 13th mairi, a tradition that has been handed down from ancient times as a circle of the twelve signs of the zodiac.

Review: A lot less crowded than normal touristy spots.
